page.title: 09Old Whittington Housing
page.content: Old Whittington is largely made up of a big Council Estate built between 1957 and 1959. When it was built there were 920 dwellings. The majority of the houses are semi-detached with a pebble-dashed exterior. There are both two and three bedroom types. Also built on the estate are four blocks of small flats mainly occupied by older couples and single aged people. Over the past few years 140 of the houses have been sold to their sitting tenants. Ninety-one percent of people questioned said they liked living in Old Whittington. Good community spirit and good shopping facilities were given as reasons by forty percent of those people asked whilst sixty-seven percent gave their main reason as being well served by the local bus service.
